text:
When i go to the default site, and try to delete a page, i get a nullpointer 
exception:

creator: brugman.justus@kpmg-ct.com
gregor@apache.org
text:
i think this is due to the xalan problems. 

can you try with xalan 2.6.0 and xerces 2.6.1 in lib and no other versions of
either in lib or endorsed?
as a a workaround, deleteschedulerentries has been commented out
creator: gregor@apache.org
ps@nomensa.com
text:
What does "deleteschedulerentries" actually do?

I can set up scheduler entries in the default publication that
publish/deactivate the document. I can delete these scheduler entries before
they complete with no problem despite the:

<!-- FIXME: temporarily disabled. see
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27252  
  <deleteschedulerentry
    documentid="${node.firstdocumentid}"
    area="${firstarea}"
    servletcontextpath="${servlet.context}"
  />
-->

I don't seem to have any problem deleting documents even if they are scheduled
for an action and deleted before that action takes place.

FWIW:
xalan-2.5.0.jar
xercesImpl-2.6.1.jar

Some light as to the problem?

I cannot reproduce the problem.

Could you please attach the full stack trace if it appears again?
creator: andreas@apache.org
